issue.title: [C++] Kernel implementations for "unique" (compute distinct elements of array)
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1559](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1559). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1559?focusedCommentId=16220896) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
All hash table related functions will need an option to address how nulls are handled. For example, null could be included or excluded from the unique values depending on the needs of the application (sometimes null is data, other times it is to be ignored).

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1559?focusedCommentId=16257747) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 1266
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1266>
